result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth R Neisius was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders bond on file to be applied. Costs have been paid in full.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth R Neisius

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:37 pm case called. Defendant Kenneth R Neisius in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over file. ADA Anderson states agreement has been completed and requests costs be assessed. Court questions defendant regarding right to counsel-defendant waives and court accepts. Court orders the defendant to pay Costs and orders bond on file to be applied. DNA Sample ans Surcharge assessed. Appeal Rights Given.
1:43 pm case recalled-same appearances-Court addresses domestic abuse enhancer on count that is plead to-ADA Anderson requests the domestic abuse enhancer be dismissed. Court dismisses the modifier outright and makes statement regarding dismissal.
Sentencing hearing on February 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Case called @ 3:56 p.m. Defendant Kenneth R Neisius in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his right to counsel. Court accepts voluntary waiver of counsel. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of Deferred Sentencing Agreement. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 1 - DRI. Court accepts terms and conditions of Deferred Sentencing Agreement.  Matter stayed for 12 months. The Court reminds the defendant that the bond remains in effect throughout the pendency of the Deferred Sentencing Agreement.

Pre-trial conference at 02-03-2016 11:00 am.
Status conference at 03-08-2016 09:20 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 3:39 p.m. Defendant Kenneth R Neisius in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant does not wish to have counsel and wishes to speak with the DA's Office. Court orders $650 Cash Bond.  NGP entered.   PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 09:20 am.
